title: Meet and Eat
description: Time to kick off camp! Join us for some snacks and getting to know your fellow campers!
comment: I will be there. Looking forward to it.

title: Introduction to Max/MSP/Jitter
description: Max/MSP/Jitter is a multimedia authoring environment that enables you to create programs for real-time manipulation of media (data, audio, video, 3d). It is used in performance and installations by artists, composers, and people just like you!

title: Pop-up books and paper circuits
description: Pop-up engineering is really fun and extremely satisfying – for adults and for kids. But how might we use electricity to change the idea of what “interactive” books can be? In this session, participants will create pop-up cards that use the affordances of our materials to really investigate how circuits can change the idea of what a book can be. We’ll also consider where soft circuits are going by looking at examples in toys and wearable technologies.

title: Shop Safety!
description: Get Shop certified!

title: exploring biomimicry
description: This 2-hour workshop on biomimicry will address nature as inspiration for design and technological solutions. We will consider the biological and natural world, and work hands on to create quick prototypes using paper, pen, and some building materials, on topics that might include re-designing social networks, mapping urban spaces, and re-defining user interfaces.

title: Mobile Storytelling as a New Medium
description: Mobile Storytelling as a New Medium is the first installment of a 3 part series on creating narratives within in the framework of a app. This lecture is a survey of current artists and projects using the mobile platform to create innovative narrative forms (i.e: Christoph Niemann’s “Petting Zoo”,  David Benqué’s “The Infinite Adventure Machine”, Works from “Les Editions Volumiques” etc…).

title: ITP Mappathon: Content Making for Projection Mapping
description:
Step 1
 This week, we will learn how to make visual content using Modul8.
 We will use a png, a jpg and a movie files to make a moving image using Modul8. This method is a great tool to camp your idea.

title: Intro to Jitter & computer vision
description: Jitter is a video library for Max, by cycling 74. There’s a lot to explore in this toolset : real-time video manipulation, OpenGL, computer vision, physical modeling. So many things! You can find out about more about the package at the cycling74 website.

title: Introduction to Soft Circuits
description: In this class, we will go over conductive materials used in creating soft circuits, such as different thread, fabrics, inks and fasteners, along with looking at microcontrollers designed specifically for wearable electronics. Projects that have been created utilizing these techniques will also be shown. We will then create a simple soft circuit with a switch and that lights up a LED. Attendees will have the chance to learn or expand on basic hand sewing techniques and experience working with new materials and skills.

title: Introduction to Soft Circuits
description: In this class, we will go over conductive materials used in creating soft circuits, such as different thread, fabrics, inks and fasteners, along with looking at microcontrollers designed specifically for wearable electronics. Projects that have been created utilizing these techniques will also be shown. We will then create a simple soft circuit with a switch and that lights up a LED. Attendees will have the chance to learn or expand on basic hand sewing techniques and experience working with new materials and skills.
comment: Attending. QUESTION: will you cover ‘muscle wire’ at all?

title: Acrylic Cutting and Bending
description: Learn a fast and easy way to prototype precision parts using the laser cutter.  And then literally take it in a new direction with the acrylic bender.  Quickly turn 2D parts into 3 dimensional objects.

title: Intro to After Effects
description: I’ll be attending.

title: Hello PhoneGap
description: The miracle of mobile computing has arrived. Exceedingly powerful computers, seamlessly networked and with a variety of in-built sensors… all right in your pocket.PhoneGap is an open source framework that lets you program cross-platform mobile phone apps using HTML, Javascript and CSS. Providing a Javascript API to access  the accelerometer, GPS, notifications, and other hardware capabilities of your phone, you can write your code once and deploy the app to Android, iPhone, Blackberry and several other platforms.

title: Github
description: What will the session cover?

title: C4 – Media, Interactivity & Audio for iOS
C4 – Media, Interactivity & Audio for iOS
Really Big Video Part 1
description: This session will introduce Big Building Mapping and Video Projection. I will begin by showing examples of site-specific and video mapping pieces and then we will map a real building using a spatial scan in Mad Mapper. For homework each camper will get a scan to work from and some tips on how to create giant projections. Part 2 of the session will allow campers to showcase their mapped work projected 3 stories tall on an actual building on broadway.

title: Command-line Fu: How not to get eaten by a Grue
Connect iOS & Arduino with Bluetooth LE
description: This is a one hour crash course on how to get your iPhone (or iPad, or iPad touch) to talk to your Arduino using the new Bluetooth Low Energy (aka the Bluetooth 4.0) standard. I’ll look at the various hardware options, and do a “show and tell” with some of the available hardware that I’ll bring along for attendees to look over. I’ll finish off with a live coding demo that’ll walk people through the basics of sending data to and from an Arduino with the classic hardware “Hello World” project; I’ll blink an LED on and off, but this time I’ll do it from my iPhone over Bluetooth LE.

title: C4 – Media, Interactivity & Audio for iOS
OpenNI Kinect with Osculator, Max/Jitter, Processing, Ableton Live etc
description: 10am – 12 (some calendars are showing 11am for some reason)
comment: I’m in.  Robbie, your e-mail said 10 am but the calendar here says 11am start. Which is the correct start time?

title: ITP Mappathon: Projection Mapping with MadMapper
description:
Step 2
 This week, we will learn how to connect your visual content created from Modul8 to a projection mapping software, MadMapper.

title: Arduino 101
description: Learn the very basics of how to program with the popular platform for physical computing projects. If you took the “Hello, Arduino” session on Monday night, this session will cover that information, but also delve deeper into the topics of digital input and output as well as analog input and output.

title: Arduino Programming Basics
description: So if you want to move beyond the blinking LED and learn some more coding for the Arduino, this is the class for you. We’ll review some of the coding from Arduino 101 and then move onto variables, for loops, while loops, and writing your own functions.

title: Harvesting Defecͫ̑̑ͫͦ͗̔͆͂̍͌͗͌ͦ̈̑̔̐̔͢͢t̔s; in A̵̡bleton Live.
description: Thinking of destruction and glitch as a creative method, this workshop explores subversive methods of sound design and composition in Ableton Live.  A variety of techniques will be demonstrated and discussed. All levels of user are invited to join.

title: Intro to Scratch (and Makey Makey)
description: Scratch is a free program geared towards teaching kids introductory programming skills through gamemaking and animation. It can be paired easily with the Makey Makey, an extremely easy-to-use microcontroller that can turn anything into a keyboard. Come check it out!

title: XBee Basics Workshop
description: Learn the basics of XBee wireless communication with 802.15.4 (Series 1) radios. We’ll demystify the various different types of radios and wireless networks, work through a basic wireless serial connection and talk about direct pin access. I’ll provide loaner XBees, but if you’d like to bring your own, we’ll be using XBee Series 1 with Sparkfun’s XBee explorer. Also, please download Coolterm and FTDI drivers if you haven’t already.

title: Introduction to Distributed Sensor Networks
description: Sensors are the future of distributed data. General-purpose computing is dissipating and becoming increasingly embedded into our lives. We will soon begin to move in a sea of data, our movements monitored and our environments measured and adjusted to our preferences, without need for direct intervention.

title: 3D Scanning Workshop with the Kinect & ReconstructMe
description: We’ll explore 3D scanning using an Xbox Kinect controller with ReconstructMe software, and the steps needed to convert these scans to 3D printable models. I have built a rig for doing full body human scans. The rig builds on this turntable I built last year: http://www.thingiverse.com/thing:28454 We’ll cover my scanning technique then a workflow for taking scans to a printable mesh using Netfabb Basic. I can also touch on some tricks with Meshlab if we need to combine meshes, remesh or reduce polygon count.

title: Intro to Soft Circuits round 2
description: Did you miss the Intro to Soft Circuits workshop?

title: Intro to Soft Circuits round 2
description: Did you miss the Intro to Soft Circuits workshop?

title: Making midi devices with the arduino micro/leonardo
description: Given the interest I have received in a working midi group I wanted to do a two hour session next satruday on making a midi device using the usb-midi capable arduinos. In this workshop we will go through the electronics of hardware midi and the logistics of making a usb midi device and then we will make midi devices using the arduino hardware. You should bring a leonardo or micro as well as a sharp pc900 (which you can order through the group order https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AhRKt6oil9H-dHZFY0prX0pmSHRIdVQ0eUVxWVZfaWc&usp=sharing) for midi in and a 5 pin din connector for each way you want to go (one for in one for out).

title: Improv Electronics with TinkerKit for Arduino
description: TinkerKit is a shield for Arduino that makes it super fast and easy to prototype interactivity by just plugging in sensors and actuators without having to worry about extra circuitry, breadboarding, etc…

title: Making Things Move with Arduino
description: Want to make things move with an Arduino?  Let’s look at how we control motors, and how we design and make the gears that will let the motors move things.  Note: the first half will be dedicated to controlling motors the second half will cover gears.

title: Jitter Workshop: Coding for Video Art
Genspace Tour
comment: I’m will be there. Thanks for organizing.

title: Akimitsu Sadoi – LED Artist Workshop
description: Aki has offered to do a build workshop which should be quite fun and you’ll have something to take with you. It’s the simplest circuit with the least number of components (see image below). Yet it does share the same technical principle (multiplex LED drive with PWM) with more complex designs of his. He also think it’s a good material to get started with surface mount soldering.
comment: attending. Do we need to bring any supplies? or does the $10 cover what we’ll need?

title: VJ – Syphon / VDMX / Jitter / TouchOSC
description: Another quick introduction to VJ software! Of course many of the things we’ll discuss are applicable to the larger world of visual art. Topics include Syphon, a nifty library that allows you to create a video wormhole from one application to another; TouchOSC, the touch interface that lets you adjust virtual knobs which you can use to control variables in Max, VDMX, etc.; and using the Kinect to create a depth map video mask.

title: Hacking the Kinect skeleton into Processing – follow- up
description: This is an informal follow-up to the OpenNI in Osculator, Max Jitter Ableton class.

title: Face It
description: In this short workshop, we will examine the human face. We’ll look at the differences between face detection and face recognition as well as demonstrate examples that track the contours of the face. In addition, we’ll look at some image processing techniques for face morphing. Examples will be demonstrated in Processing.

title: Zero to Plastic Part 1: Using SketchUp to design for 3D Printing
description: Your host the Great Fredini will go through the basics of 3D design in SketchUp. We’ll cover Sketch up’s basic tools and the use of digital calipers to design a 3D object based on real world measurements. Once parts are designed, we will export them as STL files and prep them for 3D printing with Netfabb Basic and slice the file with Makerware for printing on the ITP Makerbot.

title: Zero to Plastic Part 2: 3D Scanning with ReconstructMe
description: We’ll explore 3D scanning using an Xbox Kinect controller with ReconstructMe software, and the steps needed to convert these scans to 3D printable models.
comment: attending  (but will be coming from another workshop so may be late).

title: Beat Making for Babies
description: Beat Making for Babies is a fool proof introduction to making music with your computer. We’ll cover the basics of how to make simple beats using Midi, crafting beats from original & found sounds, and the seeds of combining our beats with emerging technologies.

title: Introduction to Rhino
description: Thank you for signing up, I’m looking forward to meeting you all.

title: Introduction to Rhino
description: Thank you for signing up, I’m looking forward to meeting you all.

title: Designing Projections for a Chamber Opera
description: I recently created video projections for “Lotus Lives,” a new independent one-hour opera written for two singers, a brass quintet, percussion, and audio-video playback. I tackled everything from content design and creation, through coordinating six projectors with a live performance on a limited budget, and making sure it ran smoothly.

title: Really Big Video Part 2
description: In this session, campers will compile and project their work from the previous week onto a giant building on broadway using video mapping and one really big projector. Taught by Gabe BC

title: End-of-Camp Shindig
description: Half show & tell, half party, the End of Camp Shindig is an opportunity to celebrate the month we’ve spent together and share what we’ve created.
